title: How to Use the Quick Add Feature on Snapchat

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. It’s an app with a gray gear, usually found on the home screen.

steps.title: Tap Snapchat.
steps.content: Tap Snapchat . It will be grouped with your other apps, in the bottom half of the page.

steps.title: Slide the Contacts button to the “On” position.
steps.content: Slide the Contacts button to the “On” position. It will turn green. Now, Snapchat has access to all of your phone contacts.

steps.title: Open your device's Settings.
steps.content: Open your device's Settings. It's an app with a gear (⚙️) icon on your home screen.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Apps.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Apps . It's under the "Device" menu.

steps.title: Tap Permissions.
steps.content: Tap Permissions . It's the 3rd selection in the menu.

steps.title: Slide the button next to "Contacts" to the "On" position.
steps.content: Slide the button next to "Contacts" to the "On" position. It will turn blue-green.

steps.title: Tap the "Back" arrow.
steps.content: Tap the "Back" arrow. It's in the upper-left corner. Now, Snapchat can access the contacts on your device.

steps.title: Open Snapchat.
steps.content: Open Snapchat . It’s a yellow app with a cartoon ghost inside. This will bring you to a camera view.

steps.title: Swipe down to open the User screen.
steps.content: Swipe down to open the User screen.

steps.title: Tap Add Friends.
steps.content: Tap Add Friends . It’s near the center of the screen and has an icon that looks like a person with a plus sign.

steps.title: Tap the + Add button next to a Quick Add user.
steps.content: Tap the + Add button next to a Quick Add user. You can also get to Quick Add by going to the Chat screen. It will be the blue-lettered heading under your friends list. If a Quick Add name has been added from your phone’s contacts, it will say “In My Contacts” underneath their name.
